snippet: The Fed chairman reiterated that the central bank would watch the economy’s tempo to decide whether to provide further cash to the monetary system. But earnings continued to beat forecasts.
abstract: Stocks rise as a growing roster of companies exceed analysts' profit forecasts and as the Federal Reserve seems to leave the door open for more monetary stimulus if needed to revive the economy.
lead_paragraph: The Fed chairman reiterated that the central bank would watch the economy’s tempo to decide whether to provide further cash to the monetary system. But earnings continued to beat forecasts.
